data.title: Good old stand by
data.text: Friendly service at reasonable prices. Wide variety of Italian food will bring you back again. Pizza is a popular choice but, try the other great meals. You won't be disappointed.

data.title: Good italian food in the heart of Des Plaines
data.text: Good overall Italian food in Des Plaines across from the train station.  Wide variety menu including pizzas and pastas.  I enjoy the pizza the best here.

data.title: Good Food For a Good Price
data.text: We went to Leonas on a very hot and humid midweek evening. The staff was attentive and very helpful re: our questions for dinner. 3 of us each had something different and all our dinners were excellent . They had a wine special which we also enjoyed . The restaurant is across from the Metra station and there is convenient parking in the lot next door .

data.title: Good Pizza right across from Metra.
data.text: Leona's makes a decent thin crust pizza.  Monday night is half off pizza night.  Clean and inviting atmosphere.  Friendly staff.

data.title: Lactose Free
data.text: Went to Leona's for dinner with my wife. She love the Chicken Wings. I had the non dairy cheese pizza. It was very good. It is nice to be able to have pizza. The service was very good too.

data.title: Birthday lunch
data.text: I celebrate my birthday there and not a lover of pizza, but their barbeque chicken pizza is delicious, I will definitely go back there jut for that.

data.title: Great Food and Great Service
data.text: We went to Leona's for dinner with family. The food was great, the service was good. We really enjoyed the pasta and pizza.

data.title: Great place for family dinner
data.text: Always a fave stop for supper with my family on our way from the NW burbs to a show at SPACE or Old Town School of Folk Music. I've heard they are under new ownership, but the food remains great and service friendly and efficient. Outstanding pasta, salad and desserts. Loved the chocolate cake we shared on our last visit.

data.title: Nice overlooked spot for lunch
data.text: I think Leona's is primarily a dinner destination in Des Plaines, but I like it for lunch.  The food is great and it's quiet enough that you can conduct business.  Service on this last visit was attentive and friendly.  I particularly like their chopped salad with grilled chicken.  The peach lemonade I had to go with it was terrific.

data.title: Pretty good food!
data.text: I've had lunch here twice and liked it both times.  The chopped salad with chicken is terrific.  Service can be spotty - despite being fairly empty both times, it was difficult to get service.  But the food is good enough to make me try it a 3rd time.

data.title: The Best Italian Pizza
data.text: Such a tasty Pizza I ever had, garlic bread are awesome, salad and sour cream are very special. An awesome place to dine.

data.title: Better places out there.
data.text: Tried the pizza, it was nothing special. My waitress was foreign(not Italian) and extremely hard to understand. The restaurant smelled musty. Seeing that the place was empty is a sign that I should not have eaten there.

data.title: AWFUL EXPERIENCE
data.text:
I don't know what was worse, the food,
the customer service, or the wait time. I ordered an appetizer which took so long, the food was ready to come out. Then, the entrée I ordered was the macaroni and cheese lasagna which was greasy and tasteless and had a significant oil slick. When he brought our bill, there were two significant overcharges on the bill. I was shocked at how rude he was when we pointed them out. When he returned with the bill, only one of the charges were adjusted. We had to call him over again and explain the second error had not been adjusted. Again, he was extremely rude. He brought back the bill again, and still the error had not been corrected!  We had to explain that the bill was still not correct. Again, a very rude reaction. By this time, we were fairly certain our cars were parked on the street over the time limit, and we were afraid of getting a ticket. We waited about 10 or 15 more minutes, and finally left, leaving money on the table for the bill, tax, and a small tip. This was an awful experience, and we will not be returning.

data.title: Not what Leona's used to be
data.text:
Cheese sticks are different, calamari is different and tough, no more bread board, no more psychedelic salad, no more giant meat balls. 

Mac and cheese lasagna was horrible, separated cheese and had been obviously reheated. 

I was pleased with our service though and still left a great tip. But I'm sad to see how bad all the leonas have changed since the company sold it. 

Beware.

data.title: Just average
data.text: We went here for lunch and one of the first things that we noticed was that the menus have substantially changed.  Naturally, that usually means that things go up in price, but a lot of the really good things that used to be on the menu are no longer there.  We ordered a kid's sausage pizza and considering my grandson devoured it, I'd say it was good with adequate sausage.  I ordered the caesar salad.  It was good and there was enough.  We also ordered the chicken parmesan sandwich which came with marinara sauce.  The bread was fresh and the chicken tasted good.  Our server, Will, was efficient, though not overly personable. I think this Leona's has become a shadow of its former self and I'm not sure if it is part of the family of Leona's restaurants - though I don't know how many there are any more.

data.title: Lasagna so good!!!
data.text: My family visited this place for dinner and we enjoyed the lasagna.  We each ordered something different.  We were all happy with what we ordered.  The staff was friendly and the food was good.

data.title: SMH on the food.
data.text: We all ordered different foods and were unimpressed.  The burger was the best over pastas and pizza.  The bathrooms were disgusting.

data.title: Good Food and Service
data.text: We discovered Leona's because my mother had moved to the neighborhood. We started going there when our family got together. The food is good with a lot of variety for all our tastes. We recently had a wedding reception there with 20 people. The staff went all out for us and helped us have a memorable evening. The food has been consistently good on all our visits.

data.title: Dissapointed
data.text:
We have loved Leona's in the past but had a really disappointing experience recently.

Where is the psychedelic salad?  Where is the side giant meatball?

The house salad was dried out and looked old.  Ordered two meatballs on the side and they were $2.69 each and the size of a walnut.  Are you kidding me?  The lasagna was just OK and didn't taste like it did before.

The hostess was on the phone and had no time for us but we were the only patrons.

Won't return.

data.title: Disappointed
data.text: We ordered delivery through grub hub. Selected pizza, mixed appetizers and a pasta dish.All three were average at best; will not be ordering from them again.
